text: Trogir is a port town on the Adriatic coast in Split-Dalmatia County, Croatia. In 2011, 10,923 people lived there. Trogir is on a small island between the Croatian mainland and the island of ÄŒiovo. It is west of Split. Since 1997, the historic centre of Trogir was added as a UNESCO World Heritage Site for its Venetian architecture and Kamerlengo Castle. Its largest building is the medieval church of St. Lawrence. ==Reference== Category:Towns in Croatia Category:World Heritage Sites in Croatia Category:Split-Dalmatia County
title: Trogir
